intro: Pongelion vilmorinianum, commonly known as the Vilmorin's bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes many other bellflowers. Pongelion vilmorinianum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
